author: R.S.N. Muraliandvictoria Brown
title: Kit Siang apologises to people of Malacca over DAP resignations - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Tuesday, 14 February 2017 | MYT 3:24 PM Kit Siang apologises to people of Malacca over DAP resignations 
MALACCA: DAP veteran Lim Kit Siang (pic) has apologised to the people of Malacca following the resignation of four state representatives. 
He also called on DAP supporters in the state to continue supporting the party. 
"I want to apologise to the people of Malacca for the defection of one Member of Parliament and three state assemblymen in Malacca," said Kit Siang, who read out his statement at a press conference in Malacca on Tuesday. 
Kota Melaka MP Sim Tong Him and three state assemblymen dropped a bombshell on Sunday by quitting the party. 
Sim said the four had quit because the DAP now has no proper direction and had deviated from its core objectives. 
The other three who quit are former Malacca DAP chairman Goh Leong San (DAP-Duyong), Lim Jak Wong (DAP-Bachang) and Chin Choon Seong (DAP-Kesidang). 
Kit Siang said that all political parties had their problems. 
He said that the state has always been a "special place" to him. 
He said he served three terms as Member of Parliament for the seat of Bandar Melaka, later re-named Kota Melaka, in 1969, 1974 and 1982.
